content.raw:
Let me review the situation, based on Nate's comments:

* Shadows appear with gazebo6-prelease compiled from source using the version of ogre that is available in Ubuntu.
* Shadows also work with gazebo6-prelease compiled from source using libogre3d-1.9-dev
* Shadows are broken when using gazebo6-prerelease package + libogre3d-1.9-dev package and we don't know why

Right?
content.html:
Let me review the situation, based on Nate's comments:

  • Shadows appear with gazebo6-prelease compiled from source using the version of ogre that is available in Ubuntu.
  • Shadows also work with gazebo6-prelease compiled from source using libogre3d-1.9-dev
  • Shadows are broken when using gazebo6-prerelease package + libogre3d-1.9-dev package and we don't know why

Right?
